verses.verse: He that dashes in pieces<WH6327> is come up<WH5927> before your face<WH6440>: keep<WH5341> the munition<WH4694>, watch<WH6822> the way<WH1870>, make your body<WH4975> strong<WH2388>, fortify<WH553> your power<WH3581> mightily<WH3966>.

For the Lord<WH3068> has turned away<WH7725> the excellency<WH1347> of Jacob<WH3290>, as the excellency<WH1347> of Israel<WH3478>: for the emptiers<WH1238> have emptied them out<WH1238>, and marred<WH7843> their vine branches<WH2156>.

The shield<WH4043> of his mighty men<WH1368> is made red<WH119>, the valiant<WH2428> men<WH582> are in scarlet<WH8529>: the chariots<WH7393> shall be with flaming<WH784> torches<WH6393> in the day<WH3117> of his preparation<WH3559>, and the fir trees<WH1265> shall be terribly shaken<WH7477>.

The chariots<WH7393> shall rage<WH1984> in the streets<WH2351>, they shall jostle one against another<WH8264> in the broad ways<WH7339>: they shall seem<WH4758> like torches<WH3940>, they shall run<WH7323> like the lightnings<WH1300>.

He shall recount<WH2142> his worthies<WH117>: they shall stumble<WH3782> in their walk<WH1979>; they shall make haste<WH4116> to the wall<WH2346> there<WH5526>, and the defense shall be prepared<WH3559>.
The gates<WH8179> of the rivers<WH5104> shall be opened<WH6605>, and the palace<WH1964> shall be dissolved<WH4127>.

And Huzzab<WH5324> shall be led away captive<WH1540>, she shall be brought up<WH5927>, and her maids<WH519> shall lead<WH5090> her as with the voice<WH6963> of doves<WH3123>, beating<WH8608> upon their breasts<WH3824>.
But Nineveh<WH5210> is of old<WH3117> like a pool<WH1295> of water<WH4325>: yet they shall flee away<WH5127>. Stand<WH5975>, stand<WH5975>, shall they cry<WH6437>; but none shall look back.

Take the plunder<WH962> of silver<WH3701>, take the plunder<WH962> of gold<WH2091>: for there is no end<WH7097> of the store<WH8498> and glory<WH3519> out of all the pleasant<WH2532> furniture<WH3627>.

She is empty<WH950>, and void<WH4003>, and waste<WH1110>: and the heart<WH3820> melts<WH4549>, and the knees<WH1290> strike together<WH6375>, and much pain<WH2479> is in all bodies<WH4975>, and the faces<WH6440> of them all gather<WH6908> blackness<WH6289>.

Where is the living<WH4583> of the lions<WH738>, and the feedingplace<WH4829> of the young lions<WH3715>, where the lion<WH738>, even the old lion<WH3833>, walked<WH1980>, and the lion<WH738>'s whelp<WH1482>, and none made them afraid<WH2729>?

The lion<WH738> did tear in pieces<WH2963> enough<WH1767> for his whelps<WH1484>, and strangled<WH2614> for his lionesses<WH3833>, and filled<WH4390> his holes<WH2356> with prey<WH2964>, and his dens<WH4585> with prey<WH2966>.

Behold<WH5002>, I am against you, says the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, and I will burn<WH1197> her chariots<WH7393> in the smoke<WH6227>, and the sword<WH2719> shall devour<WH398> your young lions<WH3715>: and I will cut off<WH3772> your prey<WH2964> from the earth<WH776>, and the voice<WH6963> of your messengers<WH4397> shall no more be heard<WH8085>.
